turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Theo, Buzz is dead.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I didn't come this far to bury a guy that's not my dad. He owes me.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Back to plan A. The vicious cycle all over again. Theo lets go of Sheila.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: I've been trapped by Miles Kastle my whole life. She walks over to her scooter, and mounts it.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Now he's the one who's locked up and I'm the one who's free. If I gotta do this alone, I might as well start now. She revs up and peals out.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: SSHHEEIILLAAA!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: What makes you think you know me so well that you can give me an ultimatum? Huh?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Who said anything about an ultimatum? You want to find your father? Get a shovel and start digging. Hurry up, he's probably in Purgatory by now. Sheila makes a pathetic attempt to speed away from Theo. He moves up beside her again.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You're really pissing me off.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: I'm pissing you off? I'm doing what I said I'd do. What the hell are you doing? What about your word?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: My word is good, and it'll always be good. When did I ever give my word to you?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: What about plan C?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Fuck plan C!

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Your word is so good, you're never gonna give it to anyone.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You think I'm dumping you to get back into bowling. Well who's dumping who?

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: I'm not dumping you, I'm suspending you.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Sez you!

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Suck my dick!

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Very professional.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I am a professional man.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Lips still for sale?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You bet. For five bucks, I'll even throw in the tongue.

turns.speaker: SHEILA
turns.text: Can you change something this big?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Lane's closed big fellah, league night.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm not here to bowl.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: You drag that coconut around for your health, or do you know how to use it?

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm looking for somebody.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Some unfinished business.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: If you wanna do business in this town, there's other people around here got more weight than old Faz.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You guys got something going on downstairs?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: We provide some extracurricular activities for the senior citizens in the community.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Basement bingo?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Aagh! Stop! Those are my bowling fingers!

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Tell your little pal to let go.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Breeze, give him his ball back!

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Very good, busyboy.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Dwarf bowling's illegal.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: What are you gonna do, call the bowling police?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: You should probably hit the road. Go home. This place could get hazardous for your health.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: So, Buzz was stooling for you guys.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: You call it stooling, we call it cooperating. Breeze looks under Theo's car.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Why is Junior's watch in that coffin? Something stinks around here.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Your time is up, busyboy.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: Who identified the body?

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: The body was identified along proper Bowling Congress guidelines for processing a bowling related fatality.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: I'm the next of kin. I should've seen him.

turns.speaker: THEO
turns.text: You faked my dad's murder. You used him! Where is he! Theo chases Sid and Breeze around their car. He catches Sid and grabs the middle fingers on his right hand. Sid howls.

turns.speaker: SID
turns.text: Ow! Ooh! No, please! Doc said I'd be back on the planks in a week! Show him Breeze! Breeze pulls a copy of "New York Bowler" from his pocket. The headline reads "RUB OUT!:BOWLING LEGEND KACKED BY DWARFSCAM KINGPIN" with a photo of Buzz Fazeli.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Captain, open the hatch door, please ... the hatch door, Captain.  Open it, please.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Calm down, Dr. Levine.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Let me out, Captain.  Open the door!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Please, Dr. Levine.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: ... Your civil rights have been overridden!

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Open it, Captain!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Dr. Levine, please!  Return to your seat!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Fletcher?  What are you doing out there?

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: They're like pink snow, sir.  Sticky.

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: They're warm.  I can feel the heat on my legs.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Fletcher, I want you back here.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Fletcher, get away from there...

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: It's burning...

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Get out of there!

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: I can't see...

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Fletcher!  Now!

turns.speaker: FLETCHER
turns.text: I can't...

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: How big is this spacecraft?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Of what we're able to measure, roughly twenty-six hundred feet.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: In basic English, what does all this mean?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Basic English?  There's no way this spacecraft was constructed on our planet.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: There's heat coming the door.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Back away then.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Wait a minute --

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I said back away.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Would you wait a minute?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Hold on --

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Any of you get ahead of me -- walk this far up?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Alright, Beth, do that thing you did before.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: How about I just press the button?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Not everything.  Even on earth.  Take ... yeasts.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Yeasts?  Thank you, Beth, but I don't think we're gonna open it up and find a loaf of bread.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: I am not leaving without him.  Do you hear me?  We come down as a team, we leave as a team.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What are you -- his mother?  Get Norman, I want everyone ready to go.  Edmunds, the subs?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Norman!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Edmunds, do you have a 20 on Norman?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: The surface ships will be back. After the storm clears.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: How long will that be?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: They told me about sixty hours.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Two and a half days?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Back at the door -- I asked you to back away.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Yeah.  I heard you.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: There are procedures, Beth, that I want followed.  My procedures.  And considering what's going on, I want you to follow them very closely.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Forgive me.  I've never read the Navy manual.  I wonder what it says about bathroom and shower procedures.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Nobody move.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: But she's --

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Nobody move!

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: I'm not sure.  I've never seen anything like it.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: You're a fucking biochemist, aren't you?  Can't you tell us something.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Nice work, Captain sir.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Shut up, Beth.  I don't want to hear it.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Direction's east coming!

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: A squid?  The size of a whale?  I don't think so.  Target acquired.  Sixty yards.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What if it attacks?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Fifty yards and closing.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What do we use for defense?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: We're a habitat.  Not a castle.  The only defense we have is High Voltage.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: High Voltage?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: It sends 200 volts throughout the cylinder surface.  But we've never used it underwater before.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Forty yards.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: But you've tested it?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Sure.  Each time it started fires inside the habitat.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Thirty yards.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What are you saying -- we can't stop what's out there?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Where is it?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Why can't I -- ?  What the hell is going on here?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: What was that?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: He's right beneath us.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Increase positive pressure!

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: That's our reserve air.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: It's either that or we grow gills.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Don't do it, Norman!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Do you see it?

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Don't pull it, Norman.  It'll start a <u>fire</u> we can't stop.  Norman?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Do it, Norman, it's the only choice we have.  This thing is gonna crush us.

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Norman, don't do it!

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Don't do it!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Now!

turns.speaker: BETH
turns.text: Norman, please!  Don't!

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Pull it, damn it!

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Thank you, Colonel.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Captain.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Captain.  Right, forgive me.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Well, thanks for the opportuninty here -- my wife appreciates it.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Don't thank me, Dr. Johnson.  You weren't my choice.  The Pentagon made me take you.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: The Pentagon?  I didn't know I had friends in Washington.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Come with me.  The team's already waiting.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What team?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What have you been told so far?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: The usual.  Plane crash.  Survivers unknown.  Routine stuff really.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Anything else?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Nothing else.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: You talk to any reporters?  Any press?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Press?  No, I haven't.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Good.  Security's been our biggest worry.  Now that you're here we can shut this thing down tight.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: From what?  What's with all the security?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Well, we don't have all the facts yet.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: We're moving fast considering the storm.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Storm?  What storm?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: A cyclone's on it's way in.  I thought they would have told you on the phone.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: They didn't tell me anything.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: How deep is he?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: A thousand feet.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: A thousand?  An airplane crashes into a thousand feet of water -- I don't want to sound pessimistic here, but I assume there are no survivors.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Survivors?  No, I wouldn't think so.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Then why am I here?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What do you need me for?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What is it?  A military spacecraft? Like a shuttle or satellite?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Something like that.  That doesn't surprise you?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Not really, no.  Something of the military crashes in the ocean -- it explains why there was nothing on the news, why you've kept everything a secret...  When did it crash?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: As best we can estimate, it crashed four hundred years ago.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: See this?  Coral.  Geologists measured the coral growth on top of the craft to be over five meters thick.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Geologists?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Coral grows at a rate of two and a half centimeters a year --

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: -- Wait a second --

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: -- dating the crash at least that old.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Hold on --

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Maybe older --

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: -- there's got to be some mistake here -- a four hundred year old military spacecraft?  There's no such thing... our space program isn't even forty years old.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Extraordinary, isn't it?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: It's impossible.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I'm afraid it is Dr. Johnson... because it's sitting on the bottom of our ocean floor.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Off the record, I don't mind telling you, this thing scares the shit out of me.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: It doesn't make any sense.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: We think it might.  That's why we brought you here.  We've assembled your team -- they're waiting for us now.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What team?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: The one you recommended.  In the ULF report you wrote for the Bush administration.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: ULF report?  Nobody's mentioned that in years.  You mean someone actually read it?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Your report's become our bible down here, Dr. Johnson.  We've been carrying out each of your recommendations -- one by one -- to the smallest detail.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: But sir, I don't understand.  This report -- these recommendations... they're for an encounter with extra- terrestrial life.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: They pressurize us with helium.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What's wrong with oxygen?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: It's a corrosive gas.  On earth, it makes a half-eaten apple turn brown and puts the ugly, iron rust on an Oldsmobile.  At a pressure this low, oxygen becomes toxic.  Breathe it down here, and it'll do to your dick what it does to the Oldsmobile.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What is it, Norman?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Take a look.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Picked up something?  What is it?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I don't know.  But it's something alien.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Maybe we shouldn't.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: If it is alien, maybe we shouldn't try to open it at all.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Like "Thou shall not kill"?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Or maybe, it can't <u>be</u> killed.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: You mean, what's in that thing is immortal?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I don't know.  That's the point.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Everything can be killed.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Don't get hysterical, Norman.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I'm telling you, Harry's lost it. He's saying there's a deathwish out for each of us.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Look, the ships are clearing out. They're taking us topside in a matter of minutes.  Someone can check him out there, if it's that imprtant.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: All I'm saying is, someone should keep an eye on him.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Just worry about yourself.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Harry's missing.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What do you mean, he's missing?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: He's missing.  He's gone.  He left.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: He's here somewhere.  Find him.  The sub's on it's way.  Go!  C'mon!

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You can't just leave Harry down here, sir.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I told you people, nobody goes anywhere unless I say.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: But sir --

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: No "buts".  If he wants to be left, we'll leave him.  Hello?  Yes, the subs -- I want a report...  Hello...  Yes, a report. Gimme... shit.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I'm not paranoid.  I know Beth.  She can be drastic.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: How drastic?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: You don't want to know.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I think I do.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: A while back, Beth and I -- we worked at the same university.  She was assisting a chemist there -- I forget his name -- doing research, experiments.  She was also living with him.  Yeah, I know.  And when she finished her work, he kicked her out, broke off the relationship, and published five papers -- all her work -- without any thank you or acknowledgement.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: She should've known better.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: She put a razor to her wrists a day later.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: When was this?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: '81, I think.  She tried again five years ago.  I thought you should know.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: So you knew this when you wrote your report?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: At the time, I don't know, I thought putting her on the list -- it might help her career -- catch her a break.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: You knowingly recommended a woman with suicidal tendencies for a government operation --

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Wait a second --

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: -- and then brought her down here --

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: -- I didn't know it would come to this --

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: -- without a cautionary word to anyone.  You know, Ted said something to me earlier.  I think he's right.  He said, "When you got a guy who -- if he wasn't here -- he'd be standing in the unemployment line, you gotta question if you got the right guy."

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: He translated it wrong.  "My name is Jerry"?  It's like "See Spot run."

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: The message doesn't show a lack of intelligence.  It's smart.  It's approaching us in a simple way.  Like you would a dog.  Holding out your hand, letting it sniff, get used to you.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What am I -- a dog, now?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Great, okay.  Ask him about his weapons.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: That's smart.  Let's talk about guns and violence.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: You don't think weapons are important?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I think we should be careful. Consider his emotional response.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Edmunds?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Because if Jerry is powerful and also emotional...

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Damn it, Edmunds?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: ... it raises a very serious question: <u>What happens if Jerry</u> <u>gets mad</u>?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Edmunds?  Can you copy?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: If something should happen to us, the Navy will at least have partial records of what happened.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: At least our obituaries will be accurate.  That's reassuring.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I don't want you talking to Jerry.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: But sir, I think it's imperative.  I think the messages, the animals we've seen, what killed Edmunds, the reading you got earlier -- I think they're all related.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: You think he killed Edmunds?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Yes, I do.  Whatever's out there, I think is his response to us refusing to talk to him earlier.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Bullshit.  What's out there isn't alien.  It's an animal.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Maybe so.  But I think we need to ask Jerry about it.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: No.  I think we should shut down the communication lines inside the habitat.  He might be listening now.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Going active.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Jerry?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What the hell?  It shut us down.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Jerry?  Please.  Stop this.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Ted, go into the control room. Listen for my instructions.

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: Yes, sir.  I'm here.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: You see the lever on the green box? Upper right hand corner?

turns.speaker: NORMAN
turns.text: I see it.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Pull it.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Can you open that panel?

turns.speaker: EDMUNDS
turns.text: Working on it now, sir.

turns.speaker: EDMUNDS
turns.text: It's not sucking, sir.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Thank you, I can see that.  Try something else.

turns.speaker: EDMUNDS
turns.text: We don't have anything else to try, Sir.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Well, shit -- find something, do something... make something up --

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What caused it?

turns.speaker: EDMUNDS
turns.text: Nothing.  I don't know.  Everything was normal.  No changes at all.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Get him out of there.  I thought I told you people --

turns.speaker: EDMUNDS
turns.text: Harry?  Can you copy?

turns.speaker: EDMUNDS
turns.text: Subs are still at surface, sir.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Send them, damn it!  I know, but I'm not gonna be held responsible --

turns.speaker: EDMUNDS
turns.text: I'm getting no sub reading, sir.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: They're coming.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Any sign of Harry?

turns.speaker: EDMUNDS
turns.text: Nothing, sir.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Fuck him.  What?  Hello?

turns.speaker: EDMUNDS
turns.text: Nothing, sir.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What the hell is going on here?

turns.speaker: EDMUNDS
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Well, where the fuck is he?

turns.speaker: EDMUNDS
turns.text: In the ship, sir.

turns.speaker: EDMUNDS
turns.text: Sir, if the subs haven't left by now...

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: They've left, keep watching!

turns.speaker: EDMUNDS
turns.text: Sir!  Sir, the door -- it's opening.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Norman, get out of there now! Norman?

turns.speaker: EDMUNDS
turns.text: If the subs aren't here yet, sir --

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Edmunds, get in here.  I need you for this.

turns.speaker: EDMUNDS
turns.text: In a minute, sir.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: How much damage?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: To the craft?  None.  Not a scratch.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Right.  So you're saying it survived a high speed impact with water without a scratch?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I'm not saying anything, Harry, I'm just stating the facts.  The outer metal is made of a titanium alloy, built into an epoxy- resin honeycomb.  The necessary technology to bond this type of metal has never been invented.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: It's chipped.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Chipped?  The door?  How can it be chipped?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I don't know how it can be chipped, but it's chipped.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I thought you said there wasn't any damage done in the crash?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I did.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Then how can it be chipped?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Ted?  Captain?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Yes, Harry.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: We know how this craft got here. Where it's been.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: So do we.  And it seems to have picked up something on it's travels.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: No.  They don't represent a message. They aren't decorative at all.  They have another purpose entirely.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: To conceal a small break in the surface of the sphere.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: A break for what?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: So how do we get it open?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Ted seems to have some ideas.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Man is man, all he knows is man, and all he can think of is what he knows.  The anthropomorphic problem. Good, Norman.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: The what?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: So?  What's the problem?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It's nonsense.  There's enough difference between our own species to prove that.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Or it could contain some great benefit to us, some astonishing new idea or technology to help mankind.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It could.  But the odds of it being any use to us are against it.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: You don't know that.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Let's say whoever made this thing is a thousand years ahead of us, just like we are to, say, medieval Europe.  Suppose you went back to medieval Europe with a TV set.  There wouldn't be any place to plug it in.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Just tell me worst case.  Worst case of what we might find?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Gimme a report, I want --

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Ladies and Gentlemen...

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Who is that?  Where's that coming from?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Please watch your closest monitor...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It's a single sequence repeated over and over.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: We're all very proud of you, Harry, but what the hell is it?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: ... spiralling out of the center, you see: "G" is one, "B" is two, "H" is three, and so on... when I got the message.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What's the message?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I have to tell you.  It's strange.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: How do you mean, strange?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Ignorant.  The thing's ignorant.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It's not ignorant.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Are you enjoying yourself, Harry, because I don't know what the hell you're doing.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: He understands me fine.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Not now, Beth.  Please.  I want to know who we're talking to before we start talking.  Where's Edmunds?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: She's not gonna know, sir.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: He's saying, "Take me to your leader." He wants to know who's in charge.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: I'm in charge.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: With an "o".  Harold with an "o".

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What -- you want me to retype it?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: Edmunds?  Get in here.  I want to know exactly how this is being transmitted.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: She's not gonna know.

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: She wired this system.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: If the technology of that sphere is advanced enough -- the way it functions is gonna appear to us like magic.

turns.speaker: TED
turns.text: A half a mile long?

turns.speaker: BARNES
turns.text: The wing dimension alone is larger that any aircraft we've seen.
